intro: Clidemia rhamnifolia, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Clidemia rhamnifolia is often found in lowland to mid-elevation forests and is an important component of the native flora in Hawaii.
